page.title: 02Donington Hall
page.content: Donington Hall was built in 1795 by the 1st Marquis of Hastings of local stone. It has changed hands many times since then and now belongs to British Midland Airways, who acquired it for use as their headquarters in 1980, the hall being situated close to the East Midlands Airport. The external structure of the hall has been carefully restored to regain its former elegance and internal restoration is still in progress. The parkland surrounding the hall still contains some majestic oaks and other forest trees. B.M.A. provides employment for many people from the surrounding area, transport to the hall being provided by a Castle Donington based bus company.
